name: CoinAbcDenseFactorization
brief: Abstract base class for ABC factorization and dense submatrix handling

algorithms.name:
When Dense Beats Sparse:
- Small m (< 200): BLAS-3 efficiency dominates
- Nearly dense basis: Sparse overhead not worth it
- Numerical difficulty: Dense more stable
algorithms.math:
LU WITH PARTIAL PIVOTING:
Factor B = PLU where:
  P = permutation matrix (row interchanges for stability)
  L = unit lower triangular
  U = upper triangular
algorithms.complexity:
Dense factorization: O(m³)
Dense FTRAN/BTRAN: O(m²)
